ygData.subject: Re: possible cheat... Off topic - Longish
ygData.msgSnippet: ... information about this please? ... just me and my friends ;) ... somewhere where I can get ... walk around? ... encrypted?  Within ... everquest *SERVER*
ygData.messageBody:
---Omeg Felligan <omeg_felligan@...> wrote:
>
> From: "Omeg Felligan" <omeg_felligan@...>
>
> there own server? could you give me(us) more
information about this please?
> hehehe...it'd be neato to have my own server for
just me and my friends ;)
> no $10/mo either.
>
> hmmm...interesting...
>
> please give me all the info you can or point me
somewhere where I can get
> the info.
>
> thanks,
> Omeg
>
> PS..could they interact with NPCs at all or just
walk around?
>
> >Why is everyone assuming that the datastream is
encrypted? Within
> >a month of attempting it another group had an
everquest *SERVER* >emulator
> >that was able to have a client walk around the
world and see >monsters that
> >they spawned. Surely you don't think they had
time to >break ANY encoding
> >and *STILL* be able to analyize the protocol to
>the point of having a
> >working server do you?
>
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor
----------------------------
>
> Create a list for FRIENDS & FAMILY...
> ...and YOU can WIN $100 to Amazon.com. For
details, go to
> http://www.onelist.com/info/onereachsplash3.html
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
> For more information on how to join the best
roleplaying game on the net goto www.everquest.com
>
This project is no more due to lawsuit threats from
Verant towards the party that was designing it. It
was the same group of people that desidned the first
UO emulators and they had a screenshot of the EQ
emulator which showed various monsters (which I had
never seen) al grouped together in what appeared to
be East Commons. It was real and it worked but they
decided not to release because of the threats and
because they said tehy loved the game too much to
make the creators mad. They also said tehy decided
not to release it because the code could make it
possible for cheats to be developed that would take
advantage of the real EQ servers and they didn't want
to ruin the game.

It was called Emuq and the link to the website was:
http://www.swileys.com/emuq/
I don't know if anything about it is still there or
not. But that is/was the link.
-Kenny
